verses.kjv: Paul, a servant of God, and an apostle of Jesus Christ, according to the faith of God’s elect, and the acknowledging of the truth which is after godliness;
verses.web: Paul, a servant of God, and an apostle of Jesus Christ, according to the faith of God’s chosen ones, and the knowledge of the truth which is according to godliness,
verses.ct: From Paul, a servant of God and an apostle of Jesus Christ. My mission is to strengthen the faith of God's chosen people and help them understand the truth that leads to a godly life —

verses.kjv: In hope of eternal life, which God, that cannot lie, promised before the world began;
verses.web: in hope of eternal life, which God, who can’t lie, promised before time began;
verses.ct: a faith built on the hope of eternal life, which God promised before time itself began. And God cannot lie.

verses.kjv: But hath in due times manifested his word through preaching, which is committed unto me according to the commandment of God our Saviour;
verses.web: but in his own time revealed his word in the message with which I was entrusted according to the commandment of God our Savior;
verses.ct: When the right time came, he revealed his message through the preaching that was entrusted to me by the command of God our Savior.

verses.kjv: To Titus, mine own son after the common faith: Grace, mercy, and peace, from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ our Saviour.
verses.web: to Titus, my true child according to a common faith: Grace, mercy, and peace from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ our Savior.
verses.ct: To Titus, my true son in the faith we share: Grace, mercy, and peace from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ our Savior.

verses.kjv: For this cause left I thee in Crete, that thou shouldest set in order the things that are wanting, and ordain elders in every city, as I had appointed thee:
verses.web: I left you in Crete for this reason, that you would set in order the things that were lacking and appoint elders in every city, as I directed you,
verses.ct: I left you on the island of Crete so you could finish organizing what still needed to be done and appoint elders in every city, just as I instructed you.

verses.kjv: If any be blameless, the husband of one wife, having faithful children not accused of riot or unruly.
verses.web: if anyone is blameless, the husband of one wife, having children who believe, who are not accused of loose or unruly behavior.
verses.ct: An elder must be above reproach — faithful to his wife, with children who are believers and not known for being wild or disobedient.

verses.kjv: For a bishop must be blameless, as the steward of God; not selfwilled, not soon angry, not given to wine, no striker, not given to filthy lucre;
verses.web: For the overseer must be blameless, as God’s steward, not self-pleasing, not easily angered, not given to wine, not violent, not greedy for dishonest gain;
verses.ct: Since an overseer manages God's household, he must be blameless. He can't be arrogant, quick-tempered, a heavy drinker, violent, or greedy for dishonest money.

verses.kjv: But a lover of hospitality, a lover of good men, sober, just, holy, temperate;
verses.web: but given to hospitality, a lover of good, sober minded, fair, holy, self-controlled,
verses.ct: Instead, he must be hospitable, a lover of what is good, level-headed, fair, holy, and self-controlled.

verses.kjv: Holding fast the faithful word as he hath been taught, that he may be able by sound doctrine both to exhort and to convince the gainsayers.
verses.web: holding to the faithful word which is according to the teaching, that he may be able to exhort in the sound doctrine, and to convict those who contradict him.
verses.ct: He must hold firmly to the trustworthy message as it was taught, so that he can encourage others with sound teaching and also correct those who argue against it.

verses.kjv: For there are many unruly and vain talkers and deceivers, specially they of the circumcision:
verses.web: For there are also many unruly men, vain talkers and deceivers, especially those of the circumcision,
verses.ct: There are many rebellious people out there — empty talkers and deceivers — especially among those who insist on circumcision.

verses.kjv: Whose mouths must be stopped, who subvert whole houses, teaching things which they ought not, for filthy lucre’s sake.
verses.web: whose mouths must be stopped: men who overthrow whole houses, teaching things which they ought not, for dishonest gain’s sake.
verses.ct: They must be silenced, because they're ruining entire households by teaching things they shouldn't, all for the sake of dishonest profit.

verses.kjv: One of themselves, even a prophet of their own, said, The Cretians are alway liars, evil beasts, slow bellies.
verses.web: One of them, a prophet of their own, said, “Cretans are always liars, evil beasts, and idle gluttons.”
verses.ct: One of their own prophets once said, "Cretans are always liars, evil beasts, and lazy gluttons."

verses.kjv: This witness is true. Wherefore rebuke them sharply, that they may be sound in the faith;
verses.web: This testimony is true. For this cause, reprove them sharply, that they may be sound in the faith,
verses.ct: That description is accurate. So correct them firmly, so they become healthy in their faith,

verses.kjv: Not giving heed to Jewish fables, and commandments of men, that turn from the truth.
verses.web: not paying attention to Jewish fables and commandments of men who turn away from the truth.
verses.ct: and stop paying attention to Jewish myths and rules invented by people who have turned away from the truth.

verses.kjv: Unto the pure all things are pure: but unto them that are defiled and unbelieving is nothing pure; but even their mind and conscience is defiled.
verses.web: To the pure, all things are pure; but to those who are defiled and unbelieving, nothing is pure; but both their mind and their conscience are defiled.
verses.ct: To those who are pure, everything is pure. But to those who are corrupt and don't believe, nothing is pure — their minds and their consciences are both polluted.

verses.kjv: They profess that they know God; but in works they deny him, being abominable, and disobedient, and unto every good work reprobate.
verses.web: They profess that they know God, but by their deeds they deny him, being abominable, disobedient, and unfit for any good work.
verses.ct: They claim to know God, but their actions tell a different story. They are detestable and disobedient, completely unfit for doing anything good.
